title: 104_hr3665
content: The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" is the short title of this Act. It transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. The "Census of Agriculture Act of 1996" transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Section 526 of the Revised Statutes is amended to require the Secretary to take a census of agriculture every 5 years, with data collected relating to the previous year. Non-compliance with answering census questions may result in penalties under title 13, United States Code. The Census of Agriculture Act of 1996 transfers the authority to conduct the Census of Agriculture to the Secretary of Agriculture. Each census under this subsection shall include each State, the District of Columbia, and other areas under U.S. jurisdiction. Failure to disclose social security numbers in response to census requests is not a violation. The Secretary of State must approve any actions in areas under U.S. jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture can also provide information to the Secretary of Commerce for census purposes. The Secretary of State must approve actions in U.S. jurisdiction. The Secretary of Commerce can provide information to the Secretary of Agriculture for census purposes. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide information to the Secretary of Commerce for census purposes. Rules and regulations for this subsection can be prescribed by the Secretary and the Secretary of Commerce. Repeals and amendments to certain sections of the United States Code are effective from October 1, 1998. SEC. 3. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CONFIDENTIALITY OF INFORMATION. The text discusses amendments to sections of the Food Security Act of 1985 and the Revised Statutes regarding the authority to furnish information to the Department of Agriculture and Commerce while ensuring confidentiality. The text discusses the release of information under section 526(c)(6) of the Revised Statutes, ensuring confidentiality as if it were information furnished under title 13 of the United States Code. The House of Representatives passed the document on July 22, 1996, as attested by Robin H. Carle, Clerk.
